info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 7 at 1:17PM MDT until August 7 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
...MULTI-DAY CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE WITH LITTLE OVERNIGHT RELIEF...
.A multi-day critical fire weather event is ongoing this week due to low RH values into the teens and single digits, alongside poor overnight recoveries and gusty winds. Thursday will bring some of the worst conditions of the week with widespread strong west to southwest winds and very low RH between 8 and 12%.
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 8 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 434.
* WIND...West to southwest winds gusting 20 to 30 mph.
* HUMIDITY...Minimums of 10 to 15 percent
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RH AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 434
